visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: The chart should have a title 'Monthly Sales Data'. The x-axis should display months from January to December, and the y-axis should have stack labels enabled and centered. The chart should include two data series, each with monthly sales data. The first series should represent '2022 Sales' and the second series should represent '2023 Sales'. The data labels for each column should be enabled and displayed in white. The chart should use specific colors for the series: '#008000' for '2022 Sales' and '#FFA500' for '2023 Sales'. The chart should have a white background and a margin of 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a column chart with specific settings. The chart type is set to 'column', and it includes a title 'Monthly Sales Data'. The x-axis displays months from January to December, with labels styled in black and a font size of 12px. The y-axis has stack labels enabled and centered, also styled in black with a font size of 12px. The chart includes two data series: '2022 Sales' and '2023 Sales', each with corresponding monthly sales data. The data labels for each column are enabled and displayed in white. The series are colored '#008000' for '2022 Sales' and '#FFA500' for '2023 Sales'. The chart has a white background and a margin of 50 pixels on all sides, ensuring a clean and well-spaced visualization.
